recentPerformance.hitRate: Cook over 73.5 in 7 of 10 games this season
recentPerformance.cushion: Line at 73.5 vs 82.3 average = 8.8 yard cushion

keyFactors.title: Consistent Volume
keyFactors.description: Cook averaging 18.2 carries per game - elite workload. Bills committed to running game regardless of score. Volume alone should push him over 73.5.

keyFactors.title: Line Below Season Average
keyFactors.description: 73.5 line vs 82.3 YPG average = 8.8 yard cushion. Market undervaluing his consistency. Hit this number in 7 of 10 games.

keyFactors.title: Texans Run Defense Vulnerable
keyFactors.description: Texans allowing 4.3 YPC to RBs (#18 in NFL). Not elite against the run despite overall defensive ranking. Cook should find holes.

keyFactors.title: Game Script Favorable
keyFactors.description: Bills likely to run to control clock and keep elite Texans defense off field. Expected to be close game = balanced attack.

riskFactors: If Bills fall behind big, may abandon run
Texans front 7 can stuff individual runs
Ray Davis vulturing goal line carries
Bills may rely more on Allen's arm vs tough defense

jamesCook.note: Workhorse performance - all 24 Bills RB carries. Consistent gains, no explosive plays but steady.

texansRunDefense.note: Held Cook to 3.8 YPC but volume pushed him over. Solid but not dominant.

quarterBreakdown.description: Cook: 6 carries, 22 yards. Bills established run early. Texans sold out to stop pass, gave Cook room.
Cook: 7 carries, 28 yards. Hit 14-yard burst. Bills balanced with 50 yards at half.
Cook: 5 carries, 18 yards. Tougher sledding as Texans adjusted. Still grinding.
Cook: 6 carries, 24 yards. Bills ran clock trying to come back. Cleared 73.5 with 5:32 left. Final: 92 yards.

gameResults.whenCleared: Cleared 73.5 with 5:32 left in 4th quarter on 22nd carry. Finished with 92 yards - over by 18.5. Comfortable cover despite Bills losing.
gameResults.turningPoint: 2nd quarter 14-yard burst gave him cushion. 50 yards at half meant only needed 24 in second half. Consistent 4th quarter work sealed it.
gameResults.gamePace: Bills ran 24 times despite losing - committed to run game. Cook got every RB carry (no Ray Davis). Volume was key.
gameResults.teamOffense: Bills only gained 333 total yards but Cook's 92 was solid chunk. 28% of total offense came from Cook runs. Efficient if not explosive.

whatWentRight.title: Volume Delivered
whatWentRight.description: 24 carries as predicted. Bills stayed committed to run even while trailing. This volume alone pushes him over most reasonable lines.

whatWentRight.title: Line Was Too Low
whatWentRight.description: 73.5 vs 82.3 average was value. He hit 92 yards - 18.5 over. Market undervalued his consistency.

whatWentRight.title: No Ray Davis Vulturing
whatWentRight.description: Cook got 100% of RB carries. No goal line vulturing. Bills trusted him completely.

whatWentRight.title: Steady Production
whatWentRight.description: 22, 28, 18, 24 yards per quarter. Never had bad quarter. Consistency is his calling card.

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: 92 yards vs 82.3 average - 9.7 yards above. Strong performance even by his standards.
statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: 92 yards fits perfectly in recent range (76-94 last 5 games). This is who he is.
statisticalContext.vsPropLine: Over 73.5 by 18.5 yards. Comfortable cover. Never truly in danger after halftime.
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: 92 yards ranked 65th percentile for his performances. Good not great, but over is over.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: No. This was predictable outcome based on volume and consistency. Cook is one of most consistent RB props in NFL - hits his numbers 70% of time. Line at 73.5 was too low for guy averaging 82.3. This is exactly the type of prop we should be betting: consistent player, volume guaranteed, line below average. Process bet that hit as expected.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV. Line moved from 73.5 to 74.5 at some books and juice increased. Market recognized value late. We captured original number which proved to be significant (hit 92).

keyTakeaways: Consistent RB props are best props to bet - Cook is model of consistency
Volume is king - 24 carries almost guarantees reasonable yardage
Lines below season average are value - 73.5 vs 82.3 was free money
Trust the process - player averages exist for a reason
No vulture back = higher floor for volume
Even in losses, Bills commit to run - game script proof
Player props with 70%+ hit rates are exploitable edges
verdict: Textbook player prop bet. Consistent player (7 of 10 overs), guaranteed volume (18+ carries), line below average (73.5 vs 82.3). Cook delivered exactly as expected with 92 yards on 24 carries. Over by 18.5 yards - comfortable cover. This is the type of prop we should be targeting repeatedly: high-floor players with lines set below their averages. No variance, no sweat, just steady production hitting a reasonable number. Would bet this 100 times under identical circumstances.
